problem_text:
5.6. Dirichlet problem in a planar Jordan domain
Let u be a variational solution of the Dirichlet problem with zero boundary
data for the equation
L_{2m}(D_x) u = f
(5.6)
in Ω, where Ω is an arbitrary bounded Jordan domain in R^2 (see Section 3.5),
f ∈ C^∞_0(Ω) and L_{2m} is a strongly elliptic operator with real constant coeﬃ-
cients.
Problem. Prove that the solution satisﬁes
∫_Ω |∇^m u|^{4−ε} dx < ∞
(5.7)
for every small ε > 0.
This problem is unsolved even for the case of the Laplace operator which
is related to Brennan’s conjecture [7].
Inequality (5.7) holds for an arbitrary piecewise smooth domain without
cusps, see [33, Chapter 9] and [87, Chapter 4].
